faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals have unrestricted property purchase rights in Spain. EU citizens require minimal documentation; non-EU citizens need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE). No residency requirement exists, though many buyers establish residency for tax and lifestyle benefits. Legal services and mortgage providers specialize in international transactions, simplifying the process significantly.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically include 6-10% transfer tax, notary fees (1-2%), and legal fees (1%). Additionally, buyers should budget for property registration and valuation fees (typically €1,500-3,000 combined). Once acquired, annual property tax averages 0.4-1.1% of fiscal value. Our team provides detailed cost breakdowns before purchase commitment.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca offers compelling investment fundamentals. faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers qualify for Spanish mortgages through major banks. EU citizens typically access mortgages at 60-70% loan-to-value; non-EU citizens may face slightly stricter criteria but routinely secure 50-60% LTV. Interest rates remain competitive (currently 3.5-4.5%), and many lenders offer English-language support and international applicant experience.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Climate is Mediterranean with 320 annual sunshine days, mild winters (8-15°C), and warm summers (28-35°C). Rainfall is minimal and concentrated in autumn/spring.
